<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/7c886db915035bc064ca307f02c34ae9d99cc733|patch 8.2.2361: Vim9: no highlight for "s///gc" when using 'opfunc'>
patch 8.2.2361: Vim9: no highlight for "s///gc" when using 'opfunc'

Problem:    Vim9: no highlight for "s///gc" when using 'opfunc'.
Solution:   Reset 'lazyredraw' temporarily. (closes #7687)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2361: Vim9: no highlight for "s///gc" when using 'opfunc' · vim/vim@7c886db
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2361: Vim9: no highlight for "s///gc" when using 'opfunc' · vim/vim@7c886db
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: no highlight for "s///gc" when using 'opfunc'. Solution: Reset 'lazyredraw' temporarily. (closes #7687)

patch 8.2.2358: wrong #ifdef for use_xterm_like_mouse()

Problem:    Wrong #ifdef for use_xterm_like_mouse().
Solution:   Use FEAT_MOUSE_XTERM.

patch 8.2.2357: Vim9: crash when parsing function return type fails

Problem:    Vim9: crash when parsing function return type fails.
Solution:   Bail out and set return type to "unknown". (closes #7685)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2357: Vim9: crash when parsing function return type fails · vim/vim@648ea76
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2357: Vim9: crash when parsing function return type fails · vim/vim@648ea76
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: crash when parsing function return type fails. Solution: Bail out and set return type to "unknown". (closes #7685)

patch 8.2.2356: Vim9: ":put =expr" does not handle a list properly

Problem:    Vim9: ":put =expr" does not handle a list properly.
Solution:   Use the same logic as eval_to_string_eap(). (closes #7684)
